value.title: SQL Server in Microsoft Fabric? Use CETaS to move data!
value.excerpt: People have been asking "What about SQL Server?" with regards to Microsoft Fabric. Bob Ward joins us to show a way you can get your SQL data into Fabric with CETaS and the power of shortcuts in OneLake. And, then use that data in Power BI!  CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT (CETAS) (Transact-SQL) https://learn.microsoft.com/sql/t-sql/statements/create-external-table-as-select-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver16&tabs=powershell
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DB8zujLjzVo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: STOP publishing your Power BI report until you do these 5 things!
value.excerpt: Your Power BI report could be slow and not functional. Publishing to Power BI may also show you your ugly baby. Patrick has you covered with 5 things to do before publishing to get that cute baby!  Power BI Tips: External tools https://powerbi.tips/2020/08/hot-swap-report-connections-external-tools/

value.title: Getting Started with Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric Data Factory
value.excerpt: The Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric is an element for getting the data from the source, transforming it, and loading it into a destination. In this article and video, we will go through what Dataflow is and how it works with a simple example of it. Learn more from my article here: https://radacad.com/getting-started-with-dataflow-in-microsoft-fabric-data-factory

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to clean, transform, and load data in Power BI.

value.title: Implement row-level security
value.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Advanced Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  00:00 Intro & Problem description 01:19 How power query concatenates columns with Table.CombineColumns

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
